title.narrative: CHILD SURVIVAL

description.narrative: Women, boys and girls among the vulnerable and emergency affected populations including those in IDP and refugee camps enjoy acceptable standards of nutrition and proven child survival interventions, which contributes to Child Health, Health And Emergencies, Nutrition And Emergencies, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Mothers, children and adolescents affected by humanitarian crisis, emergencies and disease outbreaks access high-impact/ life- saving cost effective proven interventions (WASH-HEALTH/NUTRITION) and Education and Child Protection interventions with an equitable, gender and participatory approach.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

Relief co-ordination, protection and support services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Women, boys and girls among the vulnerable and emergency affected populations including those in IDP and refugee camps enjoyacceptable standards of nutrition and proven child survival interventions
Children 6-59 months (boys and girls) receiving Vitamin A supplementation
Children 0-59 months vaccinated for polio
Children under 1 year are covered with measles vaccination
Children under 2 years (boys and girls) fully covered with routine Immunization antigens
